New Records: Tarik Skubal became the fourth Tigers lefty to record 200 strikeouts in a season, joining Mickey Lolich, Hal Newhouser, and Matthew Boyd
Key Match Events: Tarik Skubal pitched a career-high eight innings and helped the Tigers beat the Boston Red Sox, 2-1, at Comerica Park on Saturday
Ryan Kreidler made a tough throw across the diamond to retire Triston Casas leading off the eighth inning
Zach McKinstry doubled in the second inning, extending his hitting streak to a team-best 11 games
Post-Match Reflections: Manager AJ Hinch praised Skubal's performance, saying he was'very efficient and dominant'
Spencer Torkelson called Skubal 'unbelievable', citing his conviction and intent behind every pitch
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of a crowd of 34,355, who came early to celebrate the 40-year anniversary of the 1984 World Series championship
The Tigers scored their two runs in the span of three hitters in the second inning
The team's defense was stellar behind Skubal, with several key plays to help him finish the game
